commitResults.messageTitle: Converted Address, Email and Phone to optional fields in a Company instance
commitResults.messageBody:
- Updated AddCompanyCommandParser by removing the requirement of prefixes for phone, email and address fields

- Created a new function getOptionalValue in the ArgumentMultimap to obtain values for fields which are non-compulsory

- Updated isValid functions for Phone, Address and Email fields such that empty strings are also recognised as valid strings

- Updated tests for the altered classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement minor UI changes, fix UI bugs and add JavaDocs for some methods
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added a new listener to the list of roles such that whenever the list is empty, the StackPane containing the roles is cleared and will not be reflected. The listener will also update the roleTags
whenever the list of roles is changed.

- Removed CSS which highlights Roles upon clicking the Role in the UI

- Minor changes to the formatting of roles by standardising spacing between each line

- Added JavaDocs for addRole and deleteRole methods in the RoleManager class

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement additional fix for UI Bug regarding addRole command
commitResults.messageBody:
- Abstracted the updating of the roleListPanelPlaceholder into a function

- Alter roleListPanel whenever roleList is altered and updates the roleListPanelPlaceholder with the new roleListPanel

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement find command to search for roles
commitResults.messageBody:
- Find command now has two parameters with two prefixes "r/" to indicate Role name and "c/" to indicate Company name. Both prefixes are optional prefixes but they cannot both be empty.

- New RoleNameContainsKeywordsPredicate class is a predicate to determine if a Role name matches any of the keywords provide in the user input after the "r/" prefix

- RoleManager now contains two lists, an ObservableList and a FilteredList, to display Roles that match Role keywords provided by the user when performing the Find command

- FindCommand now requires two predicates, namely the CompanyNameContainsKeywordsPredicate and the RoleNameContainsKeywordsPredicate

- StringUtil containsWordIgnoreCase function now does not check that the Word parameter is not empty, to cater for missing optional Role or Company fields in the Find Command

- ModelManager updateFilteredCompanyList function now takes in two predicates to update the model based on the Predicate<Company> and the Predicate<Role>

- CompanyNameContainsKeywordsPredicate class now not only checks whether the Company contains Company Keywords entered in user input, but also checks whether the Company contains any Roles which match Role Keywords entered in user input

- CompanyCard class in the UI now reflects filtered roles rather than all Roles. By default the Predicate in the FilteredList of Roles returns true for all Roles, but after performing the Find Command, this predicate is set to the respective Predicate based on user input

- JavaDocs for new methods and classes are added

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement defensive coding practices for the newly created Find Command
commitResults.messageBody:
- Assertions added within the ModelManager, RolePredicate and CompanyPredicate classes to ensure that Predicates for Roles and Companies are working as intended and no invalid Role Keywords and Company Keywords are passed into the Predicates

- Tests are updated to test that assertion errors are thrown with above changes, and provide more extensive testing of the FindCommand and related uses

- AddRoleCommandTest is updated

commitResults.messageTitle: Update User Guide with the new Find Command details
Implement updated parser logic to disallow empty strings or white spaces after a prefix
commitResults.messageBody:
- Move arePrefixesPresent method to ParserUtil, from specific Command Parser Classes to reduce code duplication

- Create hasPrefixWithoutValue method in ParserUtil class to check for empty values after prefix

- New message to warn users of empty values after prefix

- Throw Parser exception in the event where the prefix is present with and empty value (or blank spaces)

- In AddRoleCommandParser and AddCompanyCommandParser, enforce that there are no prefixes present with empty corresponding values

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement favourite, unfavourite and listFavourite commands
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created a new field FavouriteStatus within a Company to track whether a company is favourited

- Created new Parser classes to Parse favourite, unfavourite and listFavourite Commands

- The listFavourite command works similarly to the find command, where a predicate where only companies which are favourited returns true is set to the filtered company list.

- Basic testing for new command and parser classes, and for the previously created RoleManager class

- Updated User Guide with new commands

commitResults.messageBody:
- Throws Parse Exception when empty values are placed after prefixes "c/" and "r/" in the Find Command

- Update DG and UG to reflect changes

- Refactor class name of Deadline to ReminderDate to more clearly highlight the purpose of the field within the role.

- ReminderDate is now an optional field within the addRoleCommand. When users opt not to key in a reminder date, the ReminderDate field within the Role would be created with its value field set to null.

- A ReminderDate with a null value field is a valid ReminderDate.

- Updated storage to parse null-valued ReminderDate as empty strings

- Update UI to display "N/A" when any role field is empty.

- Update UG, DG and relevant UML diagrams with the newly refactored names
